website_summaries.verdict: Great introductory model for those who seek closer shaves than standard cartridge razors. Blades do wear out quickly, however.
pros: Blades are easy to change out, ideal for first time users
More affordable than standard cartridge razors
Straight razor performance without the need for honing
cons: Tang (grip handle) is very thin, hard to hold
Included blades are on the dull side
Blades do not fit evenly in holder

customer_reviews.title: It's $5
customer_reviews.text: Consider that a pack of derby blades is around $5. This is a $5 blade holder and performs like it. - The blade is hard to install, but can be done with a little time. - The handle is pretty heavy compared to the blade holder which gives it a bad balance. - The tip of the blade has a little bit of wiggle to it. - One side of the blade tends to stick out a little more. I was more scared shaving with this than my first straight razor shave. I also got terrible razor burn, although that's user error or bad blades.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob B

customer_reviews.title: Lasted awhile
customer_reviews.text: Lasted from Feb 2016 to Apr 2019. Worked well with moderate use, no problems until it just fell apart. I'll prob buy again and hope it doesn't happen again...
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Kick @ss
customer_reviews.text: Really love the product. Gets a clean cut every time. Nicked myself only twice. Nothing severe. For anyone who read the first review. That guy is a Brute. There isn't supposed to be a guard. It's not a damn trimmer. LOL. Its a RAZOR. and there's tutorials on YOUTUBE on how to use it. Which i did. And like i said. 90% safe. And 100% effective. It's only dangerous as the user. Straight razors are just as safe as handle razors.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.  Very  disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Blades are not secured in the razor. They just fall out with no force. Poor design. Wish I could return or exchange but for some reason there is no option. Almost as if they know their stuff isn’t quality. Will not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: George Smith

customer_reviews.title: Getting that defined line.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous! Absolutely worth the price. I've had mine for a long time and It broke because it ended up using it for non-personal hygiene, the item is metal and durable for its true purpose but don't use it to open something like I did, haha. I purchased again because its a must have, the blades are so on key being sharp its crazy. It fits nicely in the slot it needs to. This is not for the faint of heart, you can get that define cut you've been looking for, with this item. Pros: Sharp Sturdy Easy to handle Don't really rust Cons: Inserting a new blade can be tricky when being cautious
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This isn't dangerous because there's a blade involved and newbies might cut themselves. It's dangerous because the piece that slides over the blade (upper blade holder in their instructional video) does not sit flush with the indentations and was constantly coming undone and loose when I was trying to use it. The "secure cap" or piece that is supposed to lock the blade from coming undone didn't do that. Overall, I immediately stopped using it and returned it before I hurt myself. Do yourself a favor and skip this one or just go the safer route and get a straight razor that has a slide out loader.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This blade is awesome, saves me a trip or two to the barber! Edit 6/5/2019 I've purchased now both the black and the silver razors. The silver seems to have a slightly more tapered edge, which to me makes it easier to edge your beard, mustache or whatever purposes you're using it for. I'm not quite certain why but I found it harder to switch blades on this one than I did with its counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: Adam O.

customer_reviews.title: A fair price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent product for the price and I think if your considering it you should read other reviews because I am admittedly new to the world of straight razors, definitely not an authority on the subject. I think I was expecting the whole thing to be a little higher quality but when I consider the price, I don't feel I got ripped off. The blades dull quickly, but the box has a hundred of them in it so, I can deal with that. It's taking me a while to get used to a straight razor so I'll leave how well it works to the pros because I have no basis for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: A1 - Best razor
customer_reviews.text: Best straight razor I ever had and for cheap. Most of these complaints in comments appear to be from people who have no idea how to shave with a straight edge razoer. For me the precision of the blade hardly being exposed and stable is a huge deal for me. Most other razor holders over expose the blade making it vulnerable to bending. with this only a sliver of the blade is exposed and the covers hold it tightly in place allowing for precision cuts everytime. One word of advise is to use the pre-cut single edge blades not the double edge blades you have to snap in half. Wont fit right with those.
customer_reviews.author: TheProduct

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Great shavette to start with. This is a great deal. The coating on this shavette seems to repel everything. Soap and rust wipe right off. My only complaint is that I have mechanics grip so I tend to spread the two halves of the shank while shaving, only a smidge but enough to get frustrating. The blades can get pushed out while closing it too but that's not too bad. I just carefully push it in once it's closed. The blades that come with it are good for two shaves Max for me. They have a couple stroke break in then run really smooth until they don't all of the sudden. Overall very serviceable shave from the combo.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Saves money at the barbershop!
customer_reviews.text: If you're a man with a rapid growing beard like myself, this razor is a must. I love having a good beard line but it is so hard to keep when your hair grows back every 2 days. I got tired of spending money at the barbershop for a weekly shape-up and figured id buy the blade and try it myself. Note: it definitely takes some getting used to. The blade is extremely sharp and i cut myself for the first few times I used it. Now, I am experienced with the blade and get a barber-like finish each time i shave. It just can not compare to the shave of a traditional razor.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: DULL BLADES CANT CUT ANYTHING
customer_reviews.text: The blades you get are dull as hell. I couldn't even use them to cut leg hair. Regular facial hair is out of the question. Save your money. These blades are DANGEROUSLY dull.
customer_reviews.author: stephen will babcock

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good razor to start with but BE CAREFUL
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted to learn how to use a straight edge since I always go to the barber and they do it for me. I’m a 21 year old college student and thought I’d give it a try. I would recommend using a new blade every time that way the blade is always sharp and you can maneuver it with ease and get a clean cut. BE CAREFUL! First time I tried it on my forehead and I gashed my head not knowing how sharp the blades really are. Other than that watch some YouTube videos and you’ll become a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Rashed Elbaba

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for new single blade users
customer_reviews.text: This shavette is perfect for those interested in learning to use a single blade razor. I purchased this not knowing what I was getting into. After about 10 minutes of YouTube tutorials I learned how to hold the blade, stretch the skin and how to avoid slicing the skin. These blades are extremely sharp and seem to be a great quality. The matte black looks expensive and of quality. 100 premium blades were included in the hard plastic packaging. I’d recommend this $10 purchase to anyone wanting to explore a different way of shaving.
customer_reviews.author: AndySanders

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed
customer_reviews.text: My previous safety razor had a plastic handle that eventually fatigued and snapped at the hinge. I don't see myself having that issue as the full metal construction feels heavier and sturdier. I also appreciate the weight. I'd recommend this for anyone getting into wet/ single blade / safety razor shaving. My shave kit is Proraso shaving cream or shave butter (I've been liking the butter more recently) and in the case of using the cream a badger brush by Parker. Clean shave with no razor burn, which before was the bane of my existence.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Kraus

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I love it when I go to the barber for a beard trim and they use the straight razor. Wanted to do this on my own in-between visits, and since I am letting my beard grow out and not cutting it for a bit, I still want my cheek line to look nice. Easy to use. Pair it with a shave gel and you are good to go! The neck is a little trickier, but once you get the hang of it, it's pretty easy. Nice piece, and great price!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Evitt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I am been shaving with straight razors for some time. Was bored of my current one and was looking for one with smaller blade for more precision. Saw the reviews of this one and gave it a try. Not worth the hype, mostly people here probably dont have experience of how a good razor should be like. This one is not sharp at all so you will get alot of cuts since you will push it harder. Black color looks nice but the black and grip is not too great!
customer_reviews.author: Nabil

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Blade moves in the holder even when in the locked position. I have used straight blades since I've started shaving and this is by far the most frustrating one. The blade gets gummed up with the hair and shaving cream after every cut which makes it take longer to shave on top of the fact that the blades seem dull. Tried 3 different blades and had enough. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson M.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: After several uses it will not hold the blade securely and is starting to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: ITS SHARP
customer_reviews.text: If you are a knife guy, imagine the sharpest knife you've ever used and then multiply that by 1000. If you angle this thing slightly wrong you will have a bloody line across your face the length of the blade. My face was chewed up the first few times I used it. You'll get used to it and get comfortable with it but don't rush it AND don't think you know what you're talking about and you don't have to listen to me. You'll saw your face up! The handle is well made and with 100 razors it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Citruscitymadman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!!! I bought this to teach myself to straight razor shave. So dang easy. I literally picked it up and it felt just right in my hand. Hand the shave was so smoothe and easy! No Knicks or cuts my first go round and it was such a close shave that my wife was thoroughly impressed. So was I. Definitely recommend this. Oooo and it comes with a ton of replacement blades. It's very shower proof as well. No rust, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey Morris

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product I toss it to the trash can
customer_reviews.text: I was totally disappointed, did not worked as I expected. I toss it to the trash can It's very hard to change the blades also the blades come with it won't cut anything you need to buy your later to have a clean shave. also if you are a beginner just run away before you hurt yourself! cuz the handling is horrible and you will cut yourself %100.
customer_reviews.author: mohammadreza

customer_reviews.title: Solid craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Solid craftsmanship. I have a cheap plastic one that served me well for a long time but decided to upgrade. When I took it out the package I could immediately feel the weight of it, yet it fit in my hand so well and comfortably. Its solid and easy to place the blades into and remove. The Derby blades that came with it are amazing, super sharp. I'd highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great quality great price.
customer_reviews.text: My last blade holder was the same price but a plastic handle and felt lesser quality and eventually the hinges rusted. This is very well crafted. The place is held in place very firmly so I'm never worried about it slipping or moving. The thickness of the blade holder and how very little of the razor edge that sticks out feels like it doesn't allow me the get the angle I want all the time but I've only had a few shaves with it so may just take some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: If You’re Looking For A Straight Edge Razor—YOU FOUND IT!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! The three stars for beginners is not to discount the quality of the profit by no means but the razors are definitely premium and very sharp. Therefore, if you have never used a straight edge razor, it want to take cautious steps before shaving your face. Again I’m in awe of the quality. The product has some weight to it, which gives the feeling of having more control while shaving. I’d highly recommend anyone to buy this product! The price is great, the razors are as described (they already come broken apart, so you just have to add it to the razor), the quality is worth every penny. I’m a happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: VTMX

customer_reviews.title: My First Straight Razor
customer_reviews.text: I loved shaving with my safety razor, but whenever I let my facial hair grow out, I noticed that the safety razor tugged alot on my facial hair. So I ordered this straight razor that used replaceable blades as opposed to the cutthroat variety that needs to be sharpened. This straight razor has significantly reduced razor burn and cuts when shaving after growing facial hair out for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: KG7YTS

customer_reviews.title: Crooked after a couple uses . Never dropped .
customer_reviews.text: Honestly haven’t used it much . Only on family a couple times . Now that I actually need it for clients it got unaligned and the blade will fall out or slide . I’ve tried to align it back , no luck . Buy it if you are learning at home and soon afterwards are upgrading to something better but to use for good lifespan , NOT RECOMMENDED . Cheap made .
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a good product so far. It's good if you're just trying to shave a large area of hair. If you're trying to be more intricate, as in, just a hair or so at a time or a thin line, I find the head too thick/bulky, and there is only a tiny sliver of the blade that is visible. I typically use an older style I guess, where the blade slides into the handle, so you have just a thin blade to deal with that is more simple to maneuver. I'll definitely keep trying this one though. Maybe I'll get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: theegspot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my father. He wanted to use this to try and get a closer shave. He liked that it was affordable and it came with many replacement blades. He liked it for shaving and he would also use it for his sideburns and to clean his neckline after haircut. He said it was easy to use but it does take some time and practice to get really good at it. It is very precise and leaves a clean straight edge. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but effective
customer_reviews.text: Its a $13 razor. Quality enough to get a decent shave, cheap enough to see if single blade razors are for you. Yes, your going to cut yourself because your learning. Its a straight razor, not a safety razor or a Gillette 5 blade. Proceed with caution and go slowly. Ive been using it for 2 weeks now. Get 2 shaves per blade. After i run out of blades, i will move on to a more expensive true straight razor.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Schiavone

customer_reviews.title: Be ready for cuts
customer_reviews.text: If you dont have any experience with it, I suggest that the first time you use it is with someone who is experienced. This is sharp, really sharp. I got two cuts from this razor. I am pretty good at trying out new thing and not messing them up. My other suggestion is dont get it if you have children in house. This razor is dangerous, even putting a blade in it is dangerous. This razor is sharper than knives. So be ready for some cuts if u r using it for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Basit Ali

customer_reviews.title: and was not happy with it as the maintenance was a bit much ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a much more expensive straight blade... much more expensive, and was not happy with it as the maintenance was a bit much and even with the constant stropping and honing the blade lost its hone. Bought this set and love it. As long as you are careful with the removal and placement of the blades their is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Carnes

customer_reviews.title: Great holder, lousy blades.
customer_reviews.text: The reason itself is good tool. However the blades that came with it do not stay in place. I don't know why they just don't seem to fit, they're too loose and will fall out. You're better off buying the double edge safety razors with the paper wrapping, and snapping them in half. At least there you get the ends that will hold on to the razor.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Mc Devitt

customer_reviews.title: Saves money and gives a good shave
customer_reviews.text: This razor is solid and we'll made. It takes some practice to get it right but when you do, it gives you a close shave. The razors that come with it are ok. You get about 3 shaves from them. I bought the shark replacement blades as an add on item. They are better blades. The videos on using a straight razor on amazon is worth the time. A key starting point is always shave after a hot shower or use a hot towel to soften the hair. I ended up getting the razor and 400 blades for $22. Not a bad deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great straight razor, for the price it aint bad, the derby blades are sharp as s****!
customer_reviews.text: unless you a pro id recommend you buy some more forgiving blades with proper shave gel, the little notches that hold the blade in place are a little misaligned but hardly noticeable. cant complain for the price, do upgrade the blades tho, i have now ditched my overpriced gillette fusion razors and strictly stick with straight razors, PLEASE! learn the process of shaving with straight razors before you slice your chins off with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Blade
customer_reviews.text: For the price I can't complain. Ive never used a straight razor before so I was a little nervous. Watched a couple videos, read a few articles, bought some decent shave gel and gave it a shot. Hands down the smoothest shave I've ever had. I honestly can't wait to shave now. For a starter set it works great for this newbie. I'll run through the set of blades then pick up a higher quality straight edge.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It ok not the best
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I should of looked into the reviews more and believed them. I ordered this for father's day and although it cuts good and close the blade moves way to much. Its so unsafe. There's nothing like a screw holding the blade in place. My husband had a hard time in the beginning but it eventually worked but the blade kept moving and he would have to fix it every so often.
customer_reviews.author: Ilene

customer_reviews.title: Easy Breezy!
customer_reviews.text: Received item today and tried it out. Note that I am first time user of a straight edge like this. Easy to put the blade in, and stayed in place while using. I would advise to practice your angle on your arm briefly so that you know the angle to shave. Outside of that, clean shave with 2 small uh-ohs. The body is solid outside of the handle. It's not as firm as I would like and easy to shift while shaving. Not a big deal though. 5 stars for first use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mac

customer_reviews.title: Weak Design
customer_reviews.text: The product looks nice but doesn't do it's job very well. The locking mechanism fails to hold the blade in place properly where you constantly have to battle with the blade's alignment. When you start shaving and introduce more moisture the problem gets even worse. Not a great shaving experience, I would NOT recommend this product. looks wise the paint started coming off almost immediately as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and well priced
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to get into straight razor shaving without dealing with the stropping and sharpening that goes along with a traditional straight razor, this is a great product. Swapping out the disposable blade every 1-2 shaves means you've always got a perfect razor sharp edge to work with. These things really are sharp though, so if you're not careful, your face will look like a war crime.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Not a replacement for safety raiser, let alone a straight razor
customer_reviews.text: I abused my straight razor and had hoped this could replace it, but no such luck. The way the razors clip in, you don't get enough extended edge to get a good shave. Because of that, I can get a better shave with a safety razor. I guess I can use it as a letter opener...
customer_reviews.author: Jay Frailey

customer_reviews.title: Nice SHARP blades.
customer_reviews.text: It is what it says it is. A straight razor definitely takes some practice, especially if you're only used to using a safety razor. I'm fairly experienced with fine detailing and pressure but I still cut up my face badly the first time I used it. You can get nice clean shaves but definitely be careful and start with light pressure. If your hand slips sideways you can easily slice up your skin.
customer_reviews.author: ali tayeb

customer_reviews.title: Simple, affordable and effective
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a spare/travel razor but I use it daily as I'm too lazy to sharpen my straight razors. The price is unbeatable and the 100 blades will take anyone through at least one year of shaving for an incredible price. This is a great first straight razor for anyone wanting one, or for some just wanting something to shape after shaving with one of the (very expensive) modern razors. Great product I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Gilboe

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it, would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He has used it once and loved it! It was his first experience with using a straight razor on himself, and this made the process efficient and easy. Not one knick and he said “it had good weight to it.” He never shaves to a bare face, he just lines up his edges to keep it clean for the office.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: I Really Like It
customer_reviews.text: Great deal, and works great too. If their was a detail to stop the blade from coming out like the one stopping from going in too far it would be much easier to setup. Regardless of that, I like this way better than my old disposable razors.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Augustine Schmit

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it can be a little difficult to get the blade straight. The blade likes to move when to close the lock. Other than that this razor is great. The blades are super sharp, and you can cut yourself pretty easily if your'e not carful. But you'll get the smoothest shave you've ever gotten.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Shackelton

customer_reviews.title: Professional Barber straight edge razor
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured how to position the half blade in the blade holder, it worked like a charm. I found the larger half holes on the blade were the wrong ones to use. It caused the blade not to protrude out from the frame. I made the adjustment and used the smaller of the half holes on the razor. It worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jazman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE! The part that secures the razor to hold it into place has NO space to actually go over and secure the razor. This caused for an extremely difficult time to actually get the razor into place and you find yourself touching the razor for a higher risk of cutting your fingers and contamination of the razor (unsanitary).
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Singh

customer_reviews.title: The blade is a little stiff.  Maybe I don't know what I'm doing
customer_reviews.text: Its not for beginners, I cut myself something good with this apparatus right here. I did not have any after shave, so apple cider vinegar it was... the choice.... I made.... terrible idea. Meh, you only live once.
customer_reviews.author: Herberth Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for first timers who want to start using ...
customer_reviews.text: Great razor for first timers who want to start using straight razor. I've been using it since mid August and first time using it was scary but it went very good. Pros: light weight, well balanced, feels great in hand, easy to clean. Savings by not spending ton of money on Gillette or other product. Cons: blades, I would change or order different blades to get smoother shave. Blades included are ok but they not great. I will have to try different brand once I run out of these. Will update my review then.
customer_reviews.author: muhammad

customer_reviews.title: QUE???
customer_reviews.text: i cant find where to put the battries, It aslo didt come with the charger nor the trimmer heads. How am i suppose to line up my beard without all the heads? huh???? DO NOT HOLD THE TINY CuTE LOOKING SHARP RECTANGLES, THEY ARE SHARP! I REPEAT, ABORT MISSIION THEY ARE SHARP!!! On the box it said i would get a professional cut, however with the box no professional barber came with it. ?? soo like WHAT?! Also please do not tell my parents i bought this, they will kick me out of their basement... ps: I DEFINITELY recommend this: Philips Norelco Multigroom All-In-One Series 3000, 13 attachment trimmer, MG3750
customer_reviews.author: Talha

customer_reviews.title: Great blade
customer_reviews.text: Common sense is important here or you will butcher your self. The blades are sharp and if you know that you need to keep your skin tight And firm while shaving, you’ll get a great shave. This is my first time having this type of razor, and it cuts amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdily designed precision razor
customer_reviews.text: This razor is superior to other retail razors. I immediately noticed the difference in construction quality, as it feels very sturdy . My first razor line up with the blade provided a precision bump free shaving experience and at this price point you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Chickie Smothers Customer

customer_reviews.title: It tried to kill me!
customer_reviews.text: You MUST take it slow and easy. The final tally on my first ever use of a straight razor is as follows... 3 right thumb. 1 index finger. 4 right side neck. 2 center throat 1 right side cheek It does get better.
customer_reviews.author: G Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great gift I think
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s great for beginners or not or if it’s just a difficult thing to use period 😂😂 I bought so I could keep my fiancé’s neck clean between haircuts and then he started playing with it and enjoyed trying to learn to shave his actual face with it and he has a good time lol
customer_reviews.author: Sam&Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Bought this
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first straight edge razor. It really helps me keep my facial hair neat and clean. I can get some good detail work done with great precision. There is a bit of a learning curve but I really like this razor. Seems to be very shard, easy to use and made of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Fake kit breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to getting this “professional barber” kit and I was very disappointed to find out that it was a complete scam. Upon first use of the razor, the blade would not stay put and kept falling off so I could not even savor a single moment using this “professional” kit. You are better off using a pair of nail cutters to fix your beard than this piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Randy Alrefaey

customer_reviews.title: Classic stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a straight razor until I got this, it was super easy to use. One thing it took me a bit to get used to is the razors are basically single use. Which isn't bad considering how many blades it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Codey G.

customer_reviews.title: skip this and buy the Parker shavette and some better blades
customer_reviews.text: If you want to really begin wet shaving with a shavette press do yourself as favor and skip this and go straight to the Parker shavette. For just as little more money you can be getting much better shaves. Also do a little research on blades before you by them. I'm starting to notice the derby blades that came with this are to dull for my face and had caused a lot of Knicks and razor burn even after adjusting angle and pressure. This price caught my eye but overall the quality was lacking and was quite noticeable in the shaves you got with the utopia shavette.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap shipping Carrier
customer_reviews.text: Ítem send with the cheapest carrier which Is very lazy usos ítem did not arrive.today mail man didnt try hard enoguht to do so!, This thing Is very Small and if you dont like it you cant return it one you opened the package
customer_reviews.author: Damian Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap razor.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for sideburns or even eyebrows if you want that. Nice addition to my toiletries. Can never hurt to have this in your manly hygiene tools, plus it comes with plenty of blades which I think is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Malachi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like it! Very light and simple design. If you angle it right the end result having you feel like a pro. Like anything else in life if u don't practice and follow proper techniques the results my no be in your favor.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t lock and hold blades in place at all
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first and second time. Third time the razor blade would not lock tight and hold blade in place. I even cut my son a little before knowing that the blade was not holding in place. I have a different brand and that one seems to be woking great. I’m just glad it came with a pack of razor blades. So that is worth 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Girl Experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheaper and less wasteful way to shave (I’m a girl). I saw a bunch of reviews about how dangerous the razor is and hard to maneuver; I however didn’t experience much difficulty. I actually shaved the peach fuzz on my skin to create a “dermaplaned” effect, and my legs; I didn’t experience any major injury expect for like 3 very small nics. I can’t really help any guy out with my experience but if you’re a girl looking for a cheap shave I would 100% recommend this product. When shaving the hair comes right of the skin!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Keep your beard looking sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Super sharp blades. I like the black finish on the razor itself. It holds the blades in place nicely. If you have a beard and like to keep it sharp looking and lined up between haircuts this is a must. Plus it comes with 100 blades that a year supply of blades.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Clean up real nice with these
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a very hairy man lol! Shhh.. but we both enjoy cleaning up his beard and neck like with this becareful it's super sharp I cut him the first time I was expecting it to be full but so isn't super professional stuff here guys!
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Burnam

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: People who give this thing 5 stars obviously don’t value their money , you have to literally change the blade half way through your shave because it won’t even cut nothing half way through and the actually razor build quality is horrible, the blade would always keep falling out
customer_reviews.author: DJI MR.V

customer_reviews.title: Quality straight razor
customer_reviews.text: The whole thing feels really sturdy and well built, it’s Easy to take off and add a new razor. Easy to put away, cuts really well and easy to use for me as I was a first time user in this area
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great razor
customer_reviews.text: Obviously meant for beginners and I’m new to this the first time I used it I cut myself like twenty times haha but after the third day I was used to it and now if I cut myself it’s Bc I tried to do it fast but you can’t find a better deal it’s a great razor for $11 and cuts extremely close without being uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: HTown.JP

customer_reviews.title: Great razor
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good razor. Last one i had was not easy for me to remove blades to replace with a new one. This actually glides across when I shave and gives me that “barbershop” look on my beard. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hlozo

customer_reviews.title: Issues
customer_reviews.text: When I order this product I was excited to use a new straight razor I read a lot of reviews about but when receiving it I notice it doesn’t hold the blade in place and yes I know how to use a razor as a professional barber I try contacting the seller but had no luck so far I love the color and everything about the product but wish it was correcting working
customer_reviews.author: joe moseley

customer_reviews.title: Great feel
customer_reviews.text: This is my first straight edge razor. This razor and blades kit is a convenient purchase as it took the guess work out of pairing those items. I am surprised at how well it feels in my hand, and easy it is to maneuver. I really like the black finish over the stainless. The moving parts are nicely fit and loading the blade securely is simply accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye83

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner straight edge
customer_reviews.text: Replacement blades and the straight edge come in the same sealed packaging, easy to put in when dry, tried to remove after initial shave (being wet) and didn't have the fingernails to open it back up to take out the blade. I'm impressed, I can't seem to get the greatest grip on it myself that's why I gave 4 stars vs 5. If you want to try out a straight edge, I'd reccomend this.
customer_reviews.author: Levi S.

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a nice close shave. Make sure you go slow and have steady hands. It took me several times to make it through without cutting myself. I’m still afraid to do my neck.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Approach with caution, get your finger placement down first (without the blade added) for a test run. Once you get the hang of it, add the blade carefully. This is a lot sharper and has more room for error than a disposable blade. With that in mind, this can save you a ton of money on disposable razors and you can keep your face and hairline up on your own between barbershop visits.
customer_reviews.author: Sarina Gordon

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE DOES NOT MOVE
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. I owned the original version and spent more money hoping the quality would reflect the price. NOPE. The thing hardly moves. I gotta put elbow grease to open the thing and putting a blade in? Forget about it. The thing will not budge and when you try and work it open to put a blade in tje thing bends. Now i gotta go through the process of finding a box. Packaging it up, printing a label and driving to return it. Smh hopefully they can help me
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy handle, good quality and comes with a ton of blades. Sharp, sharp, sharp. I recommend watching a couple videos on shaving with a straight razor or invest in bandaids. Expect a couple nicks getting started but cuts as close as my 5 blade.
customer_reviews.author: kp20

customer_reviews.title: Great Straight Razor!
customer_reviews.text: First experience using a straight razor and I love it! Much easier to get straight lines for my beard and can't beat the price. Save yourself some money and stop buying countless disposable razors! Inserting the blades can be tricky at times, but once you get it down path you'll be on your way to a smooth shave.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Murray

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I could not seem to get a close shave with this thing at all, I spent at least 2 weeks practicing with this thing and it always took me about an hour to shave without carving up my face. Know that this is the first time I've ever used this type of razor, but I still feel as though this product left a lot to be desired. After a while, I instead opted to buy one of these safety razors:  . I got a much better shave in a faster amount of time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Man, no. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried on 5 different occations to use this over my usual razor. It takes forever and doesn't cut clean at all. Sliced under my nose the first time, my fault. Watched a video on how to shave with a straight razor thinking maybe I'm just that dumb. Nope. Still razor burn like a mf. Nicks and stubbly like i took a rusted kitchen knife to the face. Not worth it. Just spend the money on a better name brand razor.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not hard to learn
customer_reviews.text: I've always used a safety razor but was looking for a single-blade tool because I don't like how hair gets stuck between blades. This shavette has worked great for the few months I've had it! I use it to shave my legs. I think it comes out pretty smooth. Wasn't hard to learn either. I don't hold it according to any guide, just however it feels right. I think this will last a long time. Be sure to dry it off after every use and leave it all opened up while it's drying. I haven't seen any rust yet.
customer_reviews.author: n

customer_reviews.title: Poorly manufactured
customer_reviews.text: The grommet that holds the outer part of the locking mechanism wasn't ground flush with the inside edge of the blade sheath, and the two indents on the bottom piece of the blade sheath weren't concentric with the holes in the top part of the blade sheath, which made it impossible for the device to securely hold a blade without it falling out
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try shaving with a straight razor and I love this thing. I've cut myself a few times but once you get used to it you can shave in like 30 seconds. Its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mount

customer_reviews.title: So fresh and so clean.
customer_reviews.text: These blades have been keeping me looking fresh for 2 months now. No complaints! Blades are safely packed and the handle is easy to hold, I have big hands. If you are cutting yourself, I suggest you learn how to shave or get some better lubrication.
customer_reviews.author: Jerson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome razor.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing razor, everything fits tight and it doesn’t flop around. I’m a woman and I’ve always had a little bit of facial hair, but when my hormones became imbalanced I grew a lot more, chemical removal harmed my skin, I’m black so bleaching wasn’t an option, and I started to get razor burn from multi blade razors. Straight razors saved my skin and helped me shave every day without razor burn. This shaver is awesome and I would buy again if I ever lost it.
customer_reviews.author: Shyla Smith

customer_reviews.title: Needed a straight edge... was impressed
customer_reviews.text: Update. Used it a few times already and still happy with it. Great buy Wanted a new straight edge tried this once since it's cheap and came with 100 blades and wow just tried it and it did a great job. Happy buyer.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyTerror

customer_reviews.title: As for  the basics it's pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: Simple system unique blades fairly easy to use. First thing I noticed the actual edge of the blade is very tiny when it's in the holder this may be a little hard or awkward around tight areas
customer_reviews.author: gary o

customer_reviews.title: Not hard to use as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Well first time I’m using one of these. So far things going well. I had few light cuts the first time I used it. It will take few try’s to get really comfortable with it and to understand how to use it right. And I didn’t had any problems with installing the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Duleepa

customer_reviews.title: Good first straight razor
customer_reviews.text: I have used a safety razor for years and decided I wanted to try using a straight razor. I immediately fell in love with the precision from this type of razor! This one seems to be constructed well and it works nicely for me. It took me several minutes to figure out how to insert the blade, so a better how-to-guide would have been appreciated. Overall, pleased with this purchase as a starter straight razor.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Gipson

customer_reviews.title: The blade doesn't properly sit between the two pieces now and so the razor is essentially useless.
customer_reviews.text: When the item arrived it had a decent amount of crud on it. This wasn't a big deal as I just used a scrub pad and cleaned it off. When I used it the first time, it worked fairly well. The blades were sharp enough and I got a decent shave. I did notice right away that the two pieces that hold the blade in place were not quite lined up properly though. The pins did not fit exactly into the holes, and required some effort to get in place. By my third time using the razor one of the pins broke off. The blade doesn't properly sit between the two pieces now and so the razor is essentially useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nate N.

customer_reviews.title: Great razor. First straight razor if we are being ...
customer_reviews.text: Great razor. First straight razor if we are being honest here. I have a beard so buying razors to shave my neck and cheek lines is too costly. This is a perfect item for that. Not being used to a straight razor may cause some complications - use some good cream and a nice after shave. Expect a few cuts. My first use I nicked my cheek line and neckline. Nothing serious, but the shave was smooth as it can get. Only problem is getting the blades into the handle securely. After that - smooth shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Watson

customer_reviews.title: Shaving and lining my beard accurately
customer_reviews.text: Very solid build and doesn’t feel cheap at all! It is a razor blade so improper use can lead to bad news... Make sure to properly use at an angle so you don’t cut yourself and you are golden! Works like a charm and the blades it come with are extremely sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Juice DeLoosh

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: First time I’ve ever used a straight razor, was very easy to get the hang of. Good grip and weight to the handle, blades are nice and stay sharp throughout the shave. Pair it with a quality shaving cream and aftershave
customer_reviews.author: RockOutWithYourGlockOut

customer_reviews.title: If you've only got 15 bucks, this will do the job very well.
customer_reviews.text: As far as the shavette itself goes, it's very solid and comfortable in the hand despite what it might look like. The blades are held firmly with no slipping. As for the Derby Professional razor blades, they are extremely aggressive blades. I wouldn't recommend them for a beginner. The blades won't do any terrible damage, but they are more prone to nicks the more aggressive they are, and these are very aggressive. As for the shave with this combo, I give this overall package a good, solid B. For a travel blade, this is perfect. For daily use, this is a good replacement, but not my first recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: John Lewis Ebert

customer_reviews.title: A decent quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The razor holds up very well under normal daily use for one man. It is a little off line at the hinge, so one must be cautious while bringing the handle to the blade so as not to close it on the handle. Overall, the same caution somebody ought to be using with the straight edge razor anyhow. I have been satisfied with the product. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin L. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great shave!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this purchase but it was definitely worth it. I really like using this razor when shaving. I also bought the Tomb shave gel and when used together, they make for a great shave.
customer_reviews.author: J Davison

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother with this, save your money
customer_reviews.text: The two posts on the blade holders appeared to be warped. It wouldn't stay together even with the safety cap on. The blade fell out every single time. Aside from it not even being able to properly function it just looks poorly made next to the pictures shown on Amazon. Sloppy craftsmanship, sold to me in an unusable state. The finish on the safety cap is worn down and tarnished as well. I am aware that it is a cheap razor, and I'm a firm believer of "you get what you pay for" but what was sent to me isn't even that. Sorely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: There’s a learning curve but worth it
customer_reviews.text: If this is the first time you’re trying to shave with a safety or straight razor, warning, there is a learning curve! But at $10, 100 blades and razor, this is a steal and fantastic deal. If you are willing to spend more time shaving and save potentially hundreds of dollars this is worth it. Very close shave when you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Very rough shave. Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Well, my Harry’s razor gives a better shave. With a new blade, it was rough. So bad that I threw it in the trash after 2 days. ‘Nuff said?
customer_reviews.author: Richard Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Modern Straight Edge Razor
customer_reviews.text: Solid design with quality blades. I’ll buy this product again. The modern construction of this men’s grooming tool is world-class. They also provide replacement blades which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon R

product_meta.title: Professional Barber Straight Edge Razor Safety with 100 Derby Blades - Salon Quality Smooth Shave - 100 Percent Stainless Steel - Replacement Blades Extend Life of Shaver - by Utopia Care
feature_bullets: The chrome plating over the brass body helps deter rust for long-lasting performance
100 derby blades will help last through many shaves; each blade is individually wax paper wrapped
Features flip-able blade cover and comfortable metal grip allowing for easy maneuvering and a close shave
Classically styled straight edge barber razor made of brass with chrome finish will provide a reliable smooth and silken shave every time
Extremely economical for a fixed straight blade razor with almost no need for maintenance

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
